gurmukhi: ਬਰਖ ਚਤੁਰ ਦਸ ਭਰਥ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਪੁਨਿ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਰਾੲਿ ॥੨੪੨॥
transliteration: Barakh Chatur Das Bharath Nrip Poun(i) Nrip Sriraghuraae||242||
translation: That for fourteen years Bharat shall rule and after that you will be the king.242.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਿ ਬਸਿਸਟ ਕੋ ਬਚ ਸ੍ਵਣ ਰਘੁਪਤਿ ਫਿਰੇ ਸਸੋਗ ॥
transliteration: Soun(i) Basist Ko Bach Sravan|| Raghoupat(i) Phire Sasog||
translation: Listening to the words of Vasishtha, Ram (Raghuvir) left with a sad heart,

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤ ਦਸਰਥ ਤਨ ਕੋ ਤਜਯੋ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਬੀਰ ਬਿਯੋਗ ॥੨੪੩॥
transliteration: Out Dasrath Tan Ko Tajyo Sriraghoubeer Biyog||243||
translation: And on this side the king. Not enduring the separation of Ram, breathed his last.243.

gurmukhi: ਗ੍ਹਿ ਅਾਵਤ ਰਘੁਰਾੲਿ ਸਭੁ ਧਨ ਦੀਯੋ ਲੁਟਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Grah(i) Aavat Raghuraae Sabh(u) Dhan Deeyo Loutaae Kai||
translation: On reaching his place Ram gave all his wealth in charity,

gurmukhi: ਕਟਿ ਤਰਕਸੀ ਸੁਹਾੲਿ ਬੋਲਤ ਭੇ ਸੀਅ ਸੋ ਬਚਨ ॥੨੪੪॥
transliteration: Kattee Tarkasisuhaae Dolat Bhe Seea So Bachannd|244||
translation: And binding his quiver to his waist he said to Sita;244.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਿ ਸੀਅ ਸੁਜਸ ਸੁਜਾਨ ਰਹੌ ਕੌਸੱਲਿਅਾ ਤੀਰ ਤੁਮ ॥
transliteration: Soun(i) Seea Sujas Sujaan Rahau Kaousalliaa Teer Toum||
translation: “O wise Sita ! You stay with Kaushalya.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਕਰੳੁ ਫਿਰਿ ਅਾਨ ਤੋਹਿ ਸਹਿਤ ਬਨਬਾਸ ਬਸਿ ॥੨੪੫॥
transliteration: Raaj Karau Phir(i) Aan Toh(i) Toh(i) Sahit Banbaas Bas(i)||245||
translation: “And I shall rule again alongwith you after exile.”245.
Speech of Sita addressed to Ram :

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਨ ਤਜੋ ਪੀਅ ਸੰਗਿ ਕੈਸੋੲੀ ਦੁਖ ਜੀਅ ਪੈ ਪਰੋ ॥
transliteration: Mai Na Tajo Peea Song(i) Kaisoidoukh Jeea Paidaro||
translation: “I cannot forsake the company of my beloved even if I have to undergo a great suffering.

gurmukhi: ਤਨਕ ਨ ਮੋਰੳੁ ਅੰਗਿ ਅੰਗਿ ਤੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਨੰਗ ਕਿਨ ॥੨੪੬॥
transliteration: Tanak Na Morau An(i) An(i) Te Hoe Anan Kin||246||
translation: “For this, undoubtedly, if my limbs are chopped, I shall not turn back a little and shall not deem it and anguish.”246.
Speech of Ram addressed to Sita :
